tweet: Chairman @RepJohnYarmuth: The President’s apparent unwillingness to reach a deal to increase budget caps sets the stage for more continuing resolutions, or worse, another shutdown. We have heard repeatedly from DoD about the harm to troops & operations caused by continuing res.

Chairman @RepJohnYarmuth: The #TrumpBudget uses a dishonest OCO gimmick to increase defense spending while cutting non-defense investments critical to our national and economic security, jeopardizing homeland security, diplomacy, veterans’ services, law enforcement, & more.

Chairman @RepJohnYarmuth: We all agree that we need a military that is second to none. But securing our nation requires a comprehensive strategy, which includes nondefense activities. We must begin by raising budget caps as soon as possible.

.@LeaderHoyer: It is critical that Congress achieves a new, bipartisan spending caps agreement so we do not slash defense and non-defense investments alike.

.@RepDebHaaland: Our budget should invest in education, health care, innovation, and competitiveness. As Chairwoman of the @NRDems Subcommittee on National Parks, Forests, and Public Lands, I also support full funding for the Land and Water Conservation Fund.

.@RepMcGovern: Many SNAP recipients are families with children, elderly or have disabilities, or veterans - and benefits are modest. Our budget should reject attempts to cut aid to families struggling to keep food on the table.
.@Repbenraylujan: The @EnergyCommerce Committee will address infrastructure, health care costs, and our changing climate so that all Americans can reach their full potential.

.@RepAdams: Last year's bipartisan Farm Bill contains programs that directly or indirectly serve every American. Congress should continue to support these programs that include nutrition assistance, conservation, renewable energy, crop research, and battling opioid addiction.

.@RepCohen: Our budget should align with our values. Congress should ensure funding for non-defense discretionary spending to support priorities like health care, Medicare, food assistance, infrastructure, and diplomacy.

.@RepEBJ: The upcoming #TrumpBudget might propose cuts to research and development, innovation, education, and technology. Congress should reject these cuts and invest in agencies like NASA, NOAA, and EPA.

Rep. @StaceyPlaskett: Budgets are moral documents. Congress should invest in infrastructure, including in rural and underserved areas; rebuild schools damaged by natural disasters, such as hurricanes in USVI; and ensure access to Medicaid.

Chairman @RepJohnYarmuth: We must raise the caps, for both defense and non-defense spending, to ensure that every American family has the chance to build a better future. If we don't, investments that are vital to our economic and national security will face devastating cuts.
